name: Pope Stephen II (III)

locations.description: Pope from 752 to 757, crowned Pepin the Short

summary: Stephen II (also numbered as Stephen III) was Pope from 752 to 757. He is best known for his alliance with Pepin the Short, King of the Franks, which established the Papal States. In 754, he traveled to France and anointed Pepin and his sons, establishing the Carolingian dynasty's special relationship with the papacy. This alliance helped protect Rome from the Lombards and laid the foundation for the temporal power of the papacy.
